nodes.fullText: I have a strong academic and professional background in software technology, including machine learning, algorithms, data science, operating systems, enterprise software, home automation, gaming, websites, and mobile applications. I have extensive experience with Microsoft development environments including Windows, ASP.NET, MVC, C#, SQL, Azure, Sharepoint, and Cosmos, as well as experience with other frameworks like HTML/CSS, Javascript, Python, and AWS.
I have lead teams of up to 100 people throughout most of my career, typically as CEO or CTO. I have particular expertise and experience in leading technical teams, both onshore and offshore.

I have experience with and an understanding of business planning and executing at all levels, including vision, company and department goals, and financial. I have managed sales, marketing, human resources, financial, support, and operations groups, in additional to technical teams.
I have recruited and managed hundreds of people over my career and have particular expertise in hiring and effectively managing development teams.
I employ agile methodologies like Scrum to develop efficiently and effectively. I have worked with different organizational models, including hierarchical, matrix, and devops.

I have designed and developed award-winning products, including Windows Express, Power Launcher, Express Meter, and SmarterHome's Home Automation System, featured in the trade press, on Oprah and on the Discovery Channel.
I have worked with many software architecture patterns, including monolithic, client-server, component-based, multi-layered, data-centric, event-driven, peer-to-peer, and microservices.
I have completed my Data Science certificate coursework, and have experience in both relational and non-relational databases, include SQL, NoSQL, and MapReduce parallel systems like Hadoop.

I have both academic and professional experience with machine learning, using approaches such as Linear Regression, Logistic Regression, Decision Tree, Random Forest, SVM, Naive Bayes, KNN, K-Means, and Collaborative Filtering.

I ran the world's largest algorithm competition, Microsoft's Imagine Cup for 5 years. During that time I designed tests for tens of thousands of students annually which required solutions in the form of different types of algorithms, including recursive, backtracking, genetic, dynamic, and greedy.

tasks.fullText:
Senior Software Engineer
One of the early employees (#225), I worked on Windows 1.0, Hardware, Multimedia, and OS/2.

CEO and CTO
I founded and bootstrapped his company, which was the first Windows-only software company, producing and selling windows application and utilities. We grew to 50+ employees and won Product of the Year with no external investment.

CEO and CTO
I founded and bootstrapped his company, which developed and sold enterprise license management software. We grew to 50+ employees and I negotiated and closed a successful sale of the company to WRQ.

CTO
I ran the license management group which had been created after WRQ's acquisition of Express Systems. We were awarded a patent for our technology and achieved $10M in sales in the first year.

CEO
I founded and ran this custom software development company which grew to 75+ employees and two offshore offices (India and Philippines) and became a $10M vendor to Microsoft.

CEO and CTO
I founded and run this startup, which produces software which assesses students and job candidates on their software coding abilities.
